ChatProject
Class ServerGUI.Server

java.lang.Object
  ChatProject.ServerGUI.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Enclosing class:
ServerGUI
public class ServerGUI.Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

The Server class is a Runnable object it listens for any connections when connection is established the Session object is created It is also added to the list of sessions because server needs to remember all connected session for later communication with clients and etc...... Then the Server goes back for listening to other connections

See Also:
Runnable, ServerSocket

Constructor Summary
ServerGUI.Server()
          An empty constructor of the class simply creates ServerSocket object on the 5555 port
 
Method Summary
 void analyzeAndDisplay(java.lang.Object object)
          The analyzeAndDisplay method simply receives an object as the parameter then analyzes it then does what ever is needed depending on the object contents Instead using strings with protocol its much easier to send whole objects and extract the instance variables accordingly and do what is necessary depending on what variable is not null
 void broadcast(java.lang.Object object)
          The method broadcast broadcasts messages to all the clients that are connected to the server and this method does something a little more like show the conversations when server wants to see it simply by changing the boolean value to false the first isConverationHidden is for the Conversations Tab The second is for the connections tab for chatting with clients or simply view the conversations
 java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.net.InetAddress> getClientMap()
          The method getClientMap simply returns the TreeMap to the caller The TreeMap has all the IP's that are mapped to the clients names because no duplicate names are allowed the name serves as a key to the IP
 java.util.ArrayList<Session> getSessions()
          The method getSessions simply returns the ArrayList of all sessions to the caller that are connected to the server
 void killThread()
          The killThread method simply kills the running thread by forcing it run method to end the way it is done is by simply changing the value of the volatile boolean variable to false which in turn forces the loop to self terminate
 void removeSession(Session session)
          The method remove session simply removes session from the usersList and the model this method is called whenever someone disconnects or gets kicked out by the server which ever it is the session will be removed from both JList and ArrayList This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method
 void run()
          The run method of the Server class it accepts connections checks if the accepted connection's IP is not on the black list then creates a Session then goes for listening again if for some reason the session IP is in the black list that means this user is banned it closes the socket right away
 void updateClients()
          The updateClients method simply updates all clients as needed as soon As soon as the new session is created or terminated this method is called to send the updates to all clients this method is needed for updating the user's list on the client side because the client uses the list to send private message or files This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method Why this method needs to be synchronized because it is called in the session thread but we could have thousands of sessions so then there will be high probability that a least once on method will be called at the same time
 void updateList(Session session)
          The method updateList simply adds the element to the JList of sessions Remember that swing components could only be updated by event dispatching thread This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method Why this method needs to be synchronized because it is called in the session thread but we could have thousands of sessions so then there will be high probability that a least once on method will be called at the same time

Method Detail

run

public void run()
The run method of the Server class it accepts connections checks if the accepted connection's IP is not on the black list then creates a Session then goes for listening again if for some reason the session IP is in the black list that means this user is banned it closes the socket right away

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable

analyzeAndDisplay

public void analyzeAndDisplay(java.lang.Object object)
                       throws java.io.IOException
The analyzeAndDisplay method simply receives an object as the parameter then analyzes it then does what ever is needed depending on the object contents Instead using strings with protocol its much easier to send whole objects and extract the instance variables accordingly and do what is necessary depending on what variable is not null

Parameters:
object - to analyze and extract the data from
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when working with streams risks are unavoidable

killThread

public void killThread()
The killThread method simply kills the running thread by forcing it run method to end the way it is done is by simply changing the value of the volatile boolean variable to false which in turn forces the loop to self terminate

broadcast

public void broadcast(java.lang.Object object)
               throws java.io.IOException
The method broadcast broadcasts messages to all the clients that are connected to the server and this method does something a little more like show the conversations when server wants to see it simply by changing the boolean value to false the first isConverationHidden is for the Conversations Tab The second is for the connections tab for chatting with clients or simply view the conversations

Parameters:
object - as an Object to send to the client which will be sent to all connected clients basically object is the Packet
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when working with streams risks are unavoidable

removeSession

public void removeSession(Session session)
The method remove session simply removes session from the usersList and the model this method is called whenever someone disconnects or gets kicked out by the server which ever it is the session will be removed from both JList and ArrayList This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method

Parameters:
session - as Session to remove from the JList and ArrayList

updateList

public void updateList(Session session)
The method updateList simply adds the element to the JList of sessions Remember that swing components could only be updated by event dispatching thread This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method Why this method needs to be synchronized because it is called in the session thread but we could have thousands of sessions so then there will be high probability that a least once on method will be called at the same time

Parameters:
session - as a Session to be added to the model

updateClients

public void updateClients()
The updateClients method simply updates all clients as needed as soon As soon as the new session is created or terminated this method is called to send the updates to all clients this method is needed for updating the user's list on the client side because the client uses the list to send private message or files This method is synchronized to make sure that only one thread a a time could execute this method The acquired key is only released by the executing thread when it is done with the method Why this method needs to be synchronized because it is called in the session thread but we could have thousands of sessions so then there will be high probability that a least once on method will be called at the same time

getClientMap

public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.net.InetAddress> getClientMap()
The method getClientMap simply returns the TreeMap to the caller The TreeMap has all the IP's that are mapped to the clients names because no duplicate names are allowed the name serves as a key to the IP

Returns:
clientMap as a TreeMap

getSessions

public java.util.ArrayList<Session> getSessions()
The method getSessions simply returns the ArrayList of all sessions to the caller that are connected to the server

Returns:
sessions as an ArrayList
